data.text:
He has won more than a dozen literary prizes along with honorary degrees, fellowships, the freedom of three cities and a knighthood from the Queen.

There was, however, an award that eluded Sir Salman Rushdie. According to his ex-wife, Padma Lakshmi, the author required consolation every year that he did not win the Nobel Prize for Literature.

Ms Lakshmi, 45, a former model, cookery writer and the host of the American reality television show Top Chef, makes the claim in a memoir which ostensibly focuses on food, filtered through the lens of her own life experiences.
